row.notes: When you love someone, your love愛 must extend及 to the crow烏 upon their roof屋; Also 屋烏之愛
row.jpn: 偏愛の例え。

row.notes: Where the sad哀 cries of wild geese鴻 spread遍 across the fields野

row.notes: 曖昧・模糊 both mean unclear
row.jpn: はっきりとしないさま。

row.english: One who is satisfied with a superficial level of learning; Uninterested in the true nature of things

row.english: The smaller the IQ, the greater the rage
row.notes: A shallow浅 current瀬 becomes a vengeful仇 wave波; People of 'shallow' intelligence will lose their sh*t over minor things
row.jpn: 思慮の浅い人は、とかく取るに足らない小さな事にも大騒ぎする事の例え。

row.notes: [Playing to>阿 society世 with bent曲 truths学
row.jpn: 学問の真理を曲げて、世間や時勢に迎合すること。

row.notes: Worry可惜 for your body身 and life命
row.jpn: 体や命を大切にすること。

row.notes: The screams叫喚 that rise from Avici(阿鼻) the lowest level of the Naraka 'hell' in Buddhism
row.jpn: 非常に悲惨で惨たらしいさま。

row.notes: 阿附=obsequiousness, 迎合=flattery
row.syn: 阿諛追従,阿諛追随,迎合追従,世辞追従,阿諛曲従,阿諛苟合,阿諛奉承,阿諛逢迎,阿諛承迎
row.jpn: 人に気に入られようとしてへつらい、おもねること。

row.notes: Storing按 away armor甲 and resting休 soldiers兵
row.jpn: 戦いをやめること。

row.notes: Using four駟 horses馬 to safely安 pull a cart車 used to transport the elderly
row.jpn: 老人をいたわり手厚く遇する例え。

row.notes: From the darkness暗, shooting an arrow箭 to injure傷 a person人
row.jpn: 闇討ちをしたり、ひそかに中傷したりする卑劣な行いのこと。

row.notes: 模索=searching with your hands; 暗中=in the darkness
row.jpn: 手掛かりが無いままに、あれこれとやってみること。

row.notes: Pull按 back soldiers兵 and don't不 move動

row.notes: Use以 barbarians夷 to attack征 barbarians夷
row.jpn: 他人の力を用いて自分の利を図ること。

row.notes: Spirits意気 rising軒昂 high

row.jpn: 香りが盛んで芳しく青々と生い茂るさま。

row.notes: Whether its even夷 terrain (peaceful times) or dangerous険 terrain (difficult times), have one一 set of morals節
row.jpn: 順境にも逆境にも節操を変えないこと。

row.english: What good is success if you don't return home to brag about it?
row.notes: Xiang Yu (項羽) of Chu(楚) said if one became rich and famous and did not return home, it was like wearing clothes衣 with fine embroidery繡 but going行 out at night夜
row.jpn: 功名をあげ、また出世しても故郷に錦を飾らなければ誰も知るものが無い例え。

row.notes: A single一 sip飲 and a single一 nibble啄

row.english: One day older, one day wiser
row.notes: The superiority長 of之 being born one一 day日 earlier
row.jpn: 経験や技能などが他より少し優れていること。

row.reading: いちじゅうさいじゅう
row.notes: One一 dip入, then re再-dip入
row.jpn: 布を幾度も染めること。染色の濃いこと。

row.notes: One一 view望, 1000千 acres頃
row.jpn: 一目で彼方まで広々と見渡されること。

row.notes: Become a [high-level official>検校 in one一 night夜; In Edo period Japan, referred to those who bought their way into a position; Careful! 検校 = けんぎょう
row.jpn: 極短い間に裕福になること。

row.notes: Education is the difference between becoming a一 dragon竜 or becoming a一 boar猪; Also いちりゅういっちょ
row.jpn: 学ぶと学ばぬとによって著しく賢愚の差ができる事の例え。

row.english: Throwing caution to the wind; Putting it in God's hands; Letting Jesus take the wheel
row.notes: In Buddhism, upon reaching the Pure Land, you would continuously be reborn upon one一 lotus蓮 and entrust托 your life生 to it
row.jpn: 事の良し悪しに関わらず行動や運命をともにする意。

row.english: Even a broken clock is right twice a day
row.notes: Even a lead sword can grant the benefit利 of之 one一 good slice割
row.jpn: 船で作った切れ味の悪い刀でも一度は物を断ち切ることができる。

row.english: Living the simple life amongst nature
row.notes: Just one一 fishing pole竿 and the wind風 and moon月
row.jpn: 自然の中で悠々自適に過ごすこと。

row.notes: Once一 empty虚, once一 full盈
row.jpn: あるいは虚しく、あるいは満ちる。常に変化して一定の形を保つ事なく測りがたい事の例え。

row.english: ① Upright and honest politician ② Travelling light
row.notes: During the Song dynasty, when Bian Zhao (趙抃) transferred to Shu (蜀), he brought only a single一 koto琴 and one一 crane鶴
row.jpn: 役人が清廉な事の例え。

row.notes: Beauty that causes men to take a一 look-back顧 and could topple傾 castle城 walls
row.syn: 一顧傾国,傾城傾国,一笑千金
row.jpn: 後世の美人の例え。

row.english: One man's trash is another man's treasure
row.notes: A一 pot壺 worth 1000千 gold金. A cheap clay pot may not have much worth, but in an emergency, could be used as a flotation device to save your life
row.jpn: 普段は価値が無いものでも、時と場合によっては、それが測り知れないほど役に立つこと。

row.notes: Once一 relaxed弛, once一 tense張
row.jpn: 厳格にしたり寛大にしたりして人を程よく扱うこと。

row.notes: Everyone brings one一 type種 of food and one一 bottle瓶 of drink
row.jpn: それぞれが一品の酒の肴と一瓶の酒を持ち寄って宴会をすること。

row.notes: One一 life生 without不 committing犯 the sin of lying with a woman, according to Buddhist law. ※犯＝ぼん
row.jpn: 仏教の戒律で、一生男女の交わりをしないこと。

row.notes: Blocked by a single一 strech of water水 overflowing盈盈. Refers to Orihime and Hikoboshi separated by the Milky Way, only able to meet once a year on Tanabata
row.jpn: 水満ちわたる一筋の川。互に心惹かれながら、相見たり言葉を交わしたりできないたとえ。

row.notes: The dream夢 lasting one一 cooking炊 session. From the parable "The World Inside a Pillow" set in Hantan邯鄲, the capital of Zhao during the Warring States Period. Traveling monk Rosei (盧生) receives a pillow枕 from an old Daoist, Rosen (呂扇). Rosei sleeps upon the pillow and dreams an entire lifetime of success and riches. However, his success invites jealousy and hate, and he is betrayed and spends his final days in imprisoned with nothing. Upon dying, he awakens to find that while he experienced an entire lifetime, back in the real world, the old man had yet to even finish cooking炊 a single一 meal of yellow黄 rice粱. Rosei realizes the futility of striving so hard for fortune and fame when life is but a moment in time. A number of idioms including terms like 邯鄲, 一炊, 黄粱 and 盧生 reference this story.
row.syn: 邯鄲の枕,邯鄲夢の枕,邯鄲の夢,黄粱の夢,黄梁一炊の枕,盧生の夢
row.jpn: 人の世の栄華の儚いことのたとえ。

row.notes: Bell木鐸 that leads the一 world世. 木鐸 is a bell with a wooden clapper and a metaphor for a leader
row.jpn: 世の中の人々を教え導く人のこと。

row.english: The greatest figure of the era
row.notes: Hero雄 of之 a一 generation世
row.syn: 一時之傑,一代英雄,一世之冠
row.jpn: その時代で最も優れた英雄。当代の最も優れた人物。

row.notes: Once一 tense張, once一 relaxed弛
row.jpn: 厳格にしたり寛大にしたりして人を程よく扱うこと。

row.english: ① A temporary concern ② Something new to worry about
row.notes: A一 morning朝 of之 worry患; For ①, 一朝 means a short period of time; For ②, 一朝 means starting one morning
row.jpn: 一時の心配をいう。また、思いがけず突然起こる心配事。

row.notes: Don't forget even the kindness恩 of之 a single一 meal飯
row.jpn: 一回の食事をご馳走になった恩義。ほんの少しの恵み。

row.english: ① A simple meal ② The simple life
row.notes: One一 gourd瓢 of water and one一 lunchbox簞 of food. Said by Confucius in reference to disciple Yan Hui's (顔回) commitment to a simple life in pursuit of study.
row.jpn: 粗末な飲食物。又、倹しい暮らし。

row.notes: One一 expanse of blue碧 extending 10,000万 x [6 hectares>頃
row.jpn: 青い海や湖などが限りなく広々と広がっているさま。

row.notes: Reading覧 of之 10'clock乙 at night夜. In ancient China, the emperor would finish work at 10PM and then indulge in some reading. 乙 is a part of a set of kanji used to represent time of day.
row.jpn: 天子が書物を御覧になること。

row.notes: The trust信 of之 moving移 the tree木. When Shang Yang (商鞅) reformed the laws of the State of Qin, he made a proclamation that whoever moved the tree at the South gate to the North gate would receive 10 gold. The people doubted him, so he raised the reward to 50 gold, which was enough to entice someone to move the tree. Shang Yang then rewarded this person as promised to show the people they could have faith in the new laws.
row.jpn: 約束を実行するたとえ。

row.notes: Clothing衣 and shoes履 ragged弊 and full of holes穿
row.jpn: 貧賤の人の服装をいう。

row.english: Master of the pen and the sword
row.notes: True允 literary文 genius and true允 military武 genius in one
row.jpn: 文武とも秀で優れていること。

row.notes: Like a group衆 of之 crows烏 together合. Also 烏合の衆
row.jpn: 烏の群れの様に規律も統制も無く、ただ寄り集まっているだけの集団や軍隊。

row.english: Blessed with great intelligence and talent
row.notes: Having有 intelligence智 and high高 talent才
row.jpn: 賢くて優れた才能に恵まれていること。

row.notes: Ointment膏薬 applied to the inner内 thigh股 will constantly rub off from one thigh to the other when walking
row.jpn: 定見が無く、その時の都合であっちについたり、こっちについたりすること。又、その様な人。

row.notes: The crow's烏鳥 feelings are the same as your own私 feelings情. The crow is a symbol of filial piety, as it is thought to regurgitate food into the parent's mouth once it grows old enough to do so.
row.syn: 烏鳥之情,慈烏反哺,三枝之礼,反哺之孝
row.jpn: 親に孝養を尽くしたいという気持ちのこと。

row.english: ① Overgrown ② In high spirits
row.notes: 鬱, commonly used for 'depression,' literally depicts overgrown vegetation. This can mean 'teeming with life and vitality' or 'dark and dank.' 葱葱 is lush greenery.
row.jpn: こんもり茂るさま。又、気の盛んなさま。

row.english: When hell freezes over; When pigs fly
row.notes: From a story during the Warring States period in China. Qin Shi Huang (秦始皇) held Crown Prince Dan (太子丹) as hostage and said he would release him 'When the crow's烏 head turns white白 or the horse馬 grows horns角.' Dan beseeched the heavens to save him, and a miracle occured, to fulfill the impossible conditions Emperor Huang had set.
row.jpn: 世の中に絶対に有り得ないこと。

row.notes: The 3-legged crow烏 that lives in the sun flies飛, and the rabbit兎 of the moon runs走. These mythical animals represent the sun and moon, i.e., the passage of time.
row.syn: 兔走烏飛,露往霜来,烏兎怱怱
row.jpn: 歳月が忙しく過ぎ去ること。

row.english: ① Unclear, vague, ambiguous ② Noncommittal, half-hearted
row.notes: Existing有 or not無. 耶 is an auxiliary character used for questions. Roughly translate to: 'Yes? No?'
row.jpn: あるのか無いのあか分からないこと。又、いい加減なこと。

row.notes: Relationship交 of之 the clouds雲 and mist霞. It was said that where the clouds end is where immortals who have transcended human existence live. This phrase refers to a relationship that likewise transcends the physical world.
row.jpn: 俗世を超えた交友をいう。

row.reading: うんじょうりょうへん
row.english: A hero is a product of the times
row.notes: A metaphor for a hero being born and launched into fame and fortune by the times in which they live. As a dragon flies, clouds雲 rise蒸 like steam as the dragon竜 calls them forth to alter変 (increase) its momentum. The dragon creates a cycle of increased speed and power by virtue of calling forth clouds and using those clouds to fly. Likewise, a hero is made by the era in which the hero lives, their deeds helping to shape the times, which further launches them forward into success.
row.jpn: 英雄や豪傑が時運に乗じて起こる事をいう。

row.reading: うんちゅうのはっかく
row.english: One of advanced state of mind
row.notes: A white白 crane鶴 in中 the clouds雲
row.jpn: 世俗から離れて高尚な境地にある人のたとえ。

row.english: A sea that stretches beyond the horizon
row.notes: Clouds雲・煙 and waves濤・浪 coming together on the horizon
row.jpn: 遥か彼方で雲に連なっている波のこと。

row.english: ① Lady Luck is a fickle mistress ② Leaving it to chance
row.notes: Luck運 or no否 luck is heaven天-given賦
row.jpn: 人の運不運は天命による。

row.english: Opposite ends of the spectrum (in terms of rank, status, intelligence, ability, etc.)
row.notes: A dragon竜 among the clouds雲 and a frog蛙 in a well井
row.jpn: 地位の上下や賢愚の差の甚だしい事のたとえ。

row.notes: Overflowing盈盈 single一 stretch of water水. Refers to Orihime and Hikoboshi separated by the Milky Way, only able to meet once a year on Tanabata
row.jpn: 水満ちわたる一筋の川。互に心惹かれながら、相見たり言葉を交わしたりできないたとえ。

row.notes: Eternal永劫 recurrence回帰. Concept written of by Friedrich Nietzsche that states given infinite time and a finite number of events, events will recur in perpetuity.
row.jpn: 同じ物が永遠に繰り返してくる。生の絶対的肯定をいうニーチェ哲学の根本思想。

row.notes: Talent才 of之 snow雪 poetry詠. Refers to Xie Daoyun (謝道蘊), a poet of the Eastern Jin Dynasty. Among her most famous prose was a comparison of wintertime snow to springtime willow floss.
row.syn: 詠絮之才,柳絮之才,柳絮才髙
row.jpn: 文才のある女性をいう。

row.english: The height of extravagence / prosperity / arrogance
row.notes: 栄耀 and 栄華 both refer to prosperity.
row.jpn: 富や権勢を背景にして贅沢を極めること。人や家などが大いに栄えること。又、おごりたかぶること。

row.notes: 3三 kinds者 of benefical益 pleasures楽: enjoyment of decorum and music, complimenting others, and maintaining friends of good character. From the Analects of Confucius.
row.jpn: 有益な三つの楽しみ。

row.notes: The vow契 of之 ducks鴛鴦. 鴛=male 鴦=female. During the Warring States Period in China, there was a retainer named Han Ping (韓憑), who had his wife stolen by King Kang of Song (宗の康王). Ping was so distraught that he committed suicide, leaving instructions to be buried. Ping's wife was devastated upon hearing news of his death and committed suicide as well, leaving instruction to be buried with her husband. However, the jealous king purposefully buried them separately, but facing each other, so they would be ever so close, but never truly together. In just one night, two cherry birch trees sprouted up, one on each grave plot. Within 10 days, the branches grew outward, entangling with each other, and a pair of ducks made their nest there, forever crying in sorrow for the couple below.
row.syn: 鴛鴦夫婦,鴛鴦の衾,鴛鴦之偶,鴛鴦交頸,比翼連理
row.jpn: 夫婦の心の絆が極めて固いこと。

row.notes: The sparrow燕 and duck's雁 alternate代 flight飛 paths. Sparrows and ducks migrate during different seasons.
row.jpn: 人が互いに隔てられていることのたとえ。

row.english: Convincing yourself it's OK (to do something wrong)
row.notes: Cover掩 your ears耳 and steal盗 a bell鐘 thinking it's OK as long as you don't hear it ringing.
row.syn: 掩耳盗鈴,掩耳偸鈴,掩目捕雀
row.jpn: 浅はかな考えや知恵で自分を欺くたとえ。又、自分の良心を欺き悪事をはたらくたとえ。

row.notes: 宛転=beautifully shaped eyebrows. 蛾眉=brow hairs like moth feelers
row.jpn: 顔かたちが美しいさま。美人の形容。

row.notes: Perfectly円 integrated融 three三-fold truth諦. The Truth that all things are empty空, meaning nothing is unchanging or everlasting and therefore has no true form. The Truth of provisional仮 existence, meaning certain things can be checked and verified as true or as having form. The Truth of the Middle中 Way, which states these truths are not mutually exclusive.
row.jpn: 仏教で、空・仮・中の三つの真理がその立場を保ちながら、各々が他の二つを含む形で互いに融け合って、同時に成立していること。

row.english: ① Stoicism ② Virtuous and influential ruler
row.notes: Finding happiness by acting according to nature, such as how the [black kite>鳶 flies飛 to the heavens or the fish魚 dances躍 in the depths of the ocean.
row.jpn: 自然の本性に従い自ずから楽しみを得ることのたとえ。又、その様な道の作用のたとえ。又、人君の徳化が広く及ぶ事のたとえ。

row.notes: Using a round円 wooden木 warning警 pillow枕 to ensure you can't doze off. Sima Guang (司馬光) was a Song Dynasty official who, when studying intensely in his younger years, would use a rounded pillow, so if he dozed off, he would roll off and smack his head.
row.jpn: 苦労して一生懸命勉学に励むこと。

row.english: ① Sharp eyes and sharp ears ② A skilled journalist
row.notes: [Black kite>鳶 eyes目 and rabbit兎 ears耳
row.jpn: 鳶の様に目敏く見つける事の出来る目と、兎の様に良く聞こえる耳。

row.notes: Speaking説 freely横・竪; Also 横説豎設
row.jpn: 自由自在に弁舌をふるうこと。

row.english: ① A piece of cake ② Barely worth doing
row.notes: The accolade功 of之 pressing grass草 sideways横. Extremely easy work that comes with little reward
row.jpn: 極めて簡単な事の例え。わずかな功績のたとえ。

row.english: ① A sumptuous feast ② Showering one with gifts and food
row.notes: Bowls椀 of food飯 behavior振舞. Referred to hosting a great New Year's feast for relatives in the Edo period.
row.jpn: 盛大なご馳走。又、気前よく物を与えたりご馳走したりすること。

row.notes: Love愛 of之 a roof屋 crow烏; If you love someone, your love must extend to the crow on their roof; Also 愛及屋烏
row.jpn: 偏愛の例え。

row.english: Expression of love for a dear friend
row.notes: The Chinese poet Du Fu (杜甫) wrote of his friend Li Bai (李白) that the falling落 moonlight月 shining off the roof屋梁 was like the brilliance reflected in his face.
row.jpn: 友人を思う情が切なこと。

row.english: The gentle persuasive power of the Classic of Poetry
row.notes: Confucius used this phrase to praise the Classic of Poetry (詩経)
row.jpn: 温かさがあり、優しく手厚いこと。孔子が『詩経』の教化の力を評した語。

row.notes: Distance遠 yourself from dust塵, separate離 yourself from dirt垢
row.jpn: 仏教で、現世での迷いを断ち切ること。

row.notes: A child that has a nanny乳母 to hold their parasol日傘
row.jpn: 子供が必要以上に大切に育てられること。

row.notes: 温文=pleasant expression and demeanor, 爾雅=well-mannered
row.jpn: 態度や表情が穏やかで、言動が正しく美しいこと。

row.notes: During the Spring and Autumn Period, King Goujian of Yu (越王勾践) lost to King Fuchai of Wu (呉王夫差) upon Mt. Huiji会稽. However, as the proverb 会稽の恥を雪ぐ indicates, he was able to redeem雪 himself 恥 years later.
row.jpn: 他人から受けた忘れる事ができない屈辱。

row.kun: 弦(げん)を改(あらた)め、轍(てつ)を易(か)う
row.notes: Fix改 the strings弦 on an instrument, change易 the spokes轍 on a wheel

row.english: ① A short-lived recovery on one's deathbed ② A final shining moment before destruction
row.notes: 回光・反照 refer to bright light reflected off a surface just before sunset.
row.jpn: 人が死ぬまぎわに、一時もちなおすこと。また、物事が滅びる直前に、一瞬勢いを回復すること。

row.english: The potential to turn everything around
row.notes: The power力 to rotate廻 the heavens天 and improve a bad situation

row.kun: 門(モン)を開(ひら)いて盗(トウ)に揖(ユウ)す
row.english: Tempting fate or inviting misfortune through one's actions
row.notes: Opening開 your front gate門 and welcoming揖 a thief盗
魁塁 is to have a superior level of bravery and presence
Words言 of之 the Milky Way 河漢, i.e., boundless and empty

row.kun: 花(はな)の植える街(まち)、柳(やなぎ)の植える巷(ちまた)
row.notes: Downtown街・巷 area where willows柳 and flowers花 grow. Long ago, red-light districts were known for having many willow trees planted there. Usu 柳巷花街

row.english: Start at an elementary level and gradually work up to mastery of a field
row.notes: The success功 borne of之 lower下 (elementary) learning学

row.english: ① Governmental reform ② Out with the old, in with the new
row.notes: Originally referred to change in government, now more generally refers to innovation
A crane's鶴 longevity寿 of 1,000千 years歳. Cranes were considered to live exceptionally long.

row.english: Open-hearted and free of prejudice and bias
row.notes: 廓然 and 大公 refer to being wide open and spacious, free of negative thought

row.english: Open-hearted and free of prejudice and bias
row.notes: 廓然 is wide open and spacious, free of negative thought. 大悟 is being enlightened.

row.english: A scholar whose talents go unused

The King doubts its value and punishes Bian He by cutting off his left leg. Bian He then presents the stone to King Wu of Zhou (周武王), who also doubts its value and punishes Bian He by cutting off his right leg. Finally, Bian He presents the stone to King Wen of Zhou (周文王) who polishes it to reveal its true value as a jewel, which is made into a national treasure. Bian He's jewel璧 is also said to be the origin of the term 完璧 'perfect.'

King Helu of Wu (呉王闔閭) attempts to invade the State of Yue越 but is beaten back by King Goujian of Yue (越王勾践) and succumbs to his injuries. On his deathbed, Helu tells his successor, King Fuchai of Wu (呉王夫差), to exact revenge. Fuchai bides his time, laying臥 upon firewood薪 every night to keep thoughts of revenge on his mind. Fuchai then defeats Goujian upon Mt. Xianglu (会稽山). Goujian then spends everyday licking嘗 bitter gall胆 to keep thoughts of revenge fresh in his mind and finally exacts in 20 years later when he defeats Fucha and causes him to commit suicide.

As Liu Bang (劉邦) fled the Feast at Hong Gate (see 鴻門之会), he handed over a pair of jade ladles (for measuring and pouring wine) to be presented to Xiang Yu (項羽) and his advisor Fang Zeng (范増). Fan Zeng, enraged to find that Liu Bang had slunk away from the dinner, smashed his ladle with his sword.
A meeting between Liu Bang (劉邦) and Xiang Yu (項羽) and Hong鴻 Gate門. Many, many details can be found at: Wikipedia.
Mount Heng's (衡山) sunny陽-side (southern face) is where a duck's雁 route is cut断 short. The mountain peak is so tall, ducks cannot migrate past it.
光禄 is an official title from the Han dynasty. 池台 is an elegant building built for one of high position upon an island in the center of a lake.

row.kun: 狐(きつね)、虎(とら)の威(イ)を仮(か)る
row.english: Acting like a big shot while hiding behind the power of another
row.notes: A fox狐 assuming仮 the power威 of a tiger虎. Once there was a fox that was caught by a tiger. As the tiger is readied to feast on its prey, the fox cried, "Wait! I've been chosen by the Creator, Shangdi, to be King of all Beasts. If you doubt me, just follow me, and I'll prove it!" The fox then led the tiger along, and eventually they came across some animals. As the fox and tiger approached, the animals quickly cowered and fled. Not from the fox of courseーthey feared the fearsome tiger following behind him. The tiger, however, thought it was the fox's purported status that caused the animals fright, and believed the fox's tale.

row.english: The suffering caused by the Five Aggregates
row.notes: The Five Aggregates (五陰・五蘊) comprise human existence. They are form, sensation, perception, mental formations and consciousness. Human existence is suffering, and shedding of the Five Aggregates will relieve this suffering.

row.english: ① Someone who hasn't grown or changed as a person ② An uneducated person
row.notes: Loosely means Mr. Meng of Wu. 呉下 is a person of the Wu呉 state. 阿 is a suffix placed on names to show endearment, making 阿蒙 something like 'Mr. 蒙.' 蒙 is Lu Meng (呂蒙). When Lu Su reunited with Lu Meng after a long time apart, Lu Su was impressed with how much Lu Meng had learned and grown as a person. He said, "You're no longer that Mr. Meng of Wu I once knew."

row.english: Criticism from the corpse of Shi Qiu
row.notes: Criticism諫 from the corpse屍 of Shi Qiu (史魚). Shi Qiu governed in the state of Wei衛 during the Spring and Autumn period and was known for his honest and direct manner. He always criticized Duke Ling of Wei (霊公), who rarely listened. When Shi Qiu was on his deathbed, he instructed his son not to bury him, so his corpse could continue to criticize the Duke.

row.english: A temple compound with all seven key buildings
row.notes: In Zen Buddhism, the key "seven七 halls堂" to make a complete compound are: the main gate (山門), main hall (仏殿), lecture hall (法堂), kitchen (庫裏), zazen building (僧堂), bath (浴室) and toilet (東司). 伽藍 is a term meaning "temple." The buildings can vary based on the sect of Buddhism.

row.english: The ability to craft superb poetry off the top of your head
row.notes: The talent才 of之 seven七 steps歩. Refers to Cao Zhi (曹植) of the Three Kingdoms period. Emperor Cao Pi (曹丕) of the state of Cao Wei thought his brother Cao Zhi was plotting to usurp him. Cao Pi commanded Cao Zhi to prove his innocence by crafting a poem in just seven steps. Cao Zhi recited a poem about beans weeping as their beanstalks are burned for fuel to boil them. This is the basis for the idiom 煮豆燃萁, an allegory for brothers needlessly quarreling and destroying each other. The imagery so moved Cao Pi, that he let his brother go.

row.english: The ability to craft superb poetry off the top of your head

Emperor Cao Pi (曹丕) of the state of Cao Wei thought his brother Cao Zhi was plotting to usurp him. Cao Pi commanded Cao Zhi to prove his innocence by crafting a poem in just seven steps. During the Warring State period, a merchant of Chu楚 was attempting to sell a spear and shield.
